results.headline: HOMICIDE (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Homicide

results.summary_short: Jewish cop and anti-Semitic murder case, via Mamet. Vivid and entertaining but loses momentum.

results.headline: SUBURBAN COMMANDO (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Suburban Commando

results.summary_short: Stranded alien, like a macho Santa, moves in with California couple. Unsurprising but well paced.

results.summary_short: Cop and hit man. Mean, flashy revenge thriller. Too many contrivances.

results.headline: WHORE (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Whore

results.summary_short: L.A. streetwalker's mainly brutal memories. Plain-looking, even cheap film. Not really porno, not much of anything.

results.headline: TWENTY-ONE (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Twenty-One

results.summary_short: Smug, peevish London heroine, enough to give youth and beauty a bad name. Take her away.

results.summary_short: Landlord ordered to live in one of his own buildings. So-so comedy.

results.summary_short: A ``let's-put-on-a-show'' romp with a dash of ``Chorus Line.'' Liza is the icing and spark plug.
